title: Drawing, "Perspective designs for two palace facades"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description:
Vertical rectangle. A transept. Squared, with numbers. (RB'45)
Horizontal rectangle: Several elevations of three-story buildings with colonnades. Two line inscription at top; arithmetical figuring upper left and right. Pasted on paper backing. (XC'74)

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Perspective designs for two palace facades".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1113.
